Comment: Israel lacks the capability to deal with Iran.  Their air force isn't large enough nor do they have enough deep penetrating bombs without resorting to nuclear weapons.  This is the best time to do something.  Iran is hurting and their air defenses are almost gone.  If we were going to do something, now would be the best time.  if not, we need to accept that religious extremists who use terrorists globally to enact their foreign policy will get nuclear weapons, and that Iran will forever be able to do whatever it wants - another North Korea, except with a functioning economy.  I wouldn't support another invasion.  However an invasion isn't needed to take out nuclear research and production sites.  Considering that Iran has been attacking American forces in Iraq for more than two decades, including last year, they've been attacking our naval vessels and civilian shipping vessels, and have been carrying out atrocities against our ally, I think it is reasonable to do something before they become effectively immune to us.

Comment: Iran learned their lesson from the Iraqi nuclear reactor.  They've split their nuclear sites up around the country, and buried them deep.  Israel has planes that can hit one or maybe two of them. They also lack the number of conventional deep penetrating bombs they would need.
